title:
Optimizing Bipolar Constellations for High-Rate Transmission in
  Short-Reach Fiber Links with Direct Detection
authors: Thomas Wiegart, Daniel Plabst, Norbert Hanik, Gerhard Kramer
abstract:
Bipolar modulation increases the achievable information rate of communication
links with direct-detection receivers. This paper optimizes bipolar
transmission with a modulator bias offset for short-reach fiber links. A neural
network equalizer with successive interference cancellation is shown to gain
over 100 Gbit/s compared to standard receivers.
subjects: Electrical Engineering and Systems Science/Signal Processing
